title: Difference in include and exclude input
body:
In GitLab by @thernstig on Sep 12, 2019, 08:10

*Please describe how you installed Flake8*

Example:

```
$ pipenv install flake8
```

*Please provide the exact, unmodified output of `flake8 --bug-report`*
```json
{
  "dependencies": [
    {
      "dependency": "entrypoints",
      "version": "0.3"
    }
  ],
  "platform": {
    "python_implementation": "CPython",
    "python_version": "3.6.9",
    "system": "Linux"
  },
  "plugins": [
    {
      "is_local": false,
      "plugin": "mccabe",
      "version": "0.6.1"
    },
    {
      "is_local": false,
      "plugin": "pycodestyle",
      "version": "2.5.0"
    },
    {
      "is_local": false,
      "plugin": "pyflakes",
      "version": "2.1.1"
    }
  ],
  "version": "3.7.8"
}
```

*Please describe the problem or feature*  
There is a difference in the format to include a filename and to exclude a filename, see example below. It would be good if they matched. Notice the `./` needed for the `filename` section. `exclude` allows both with and without `./`

## Command Line and Configuration
```ini
[flake8]

filename=
  pathto/file1.py # does NOT work
  ./pathto/file2.py # works

exclude=
  pathto/file3.py, # works
  ./pathto/file4.py # also works
```

## Your Environment
* Python version: 3.6.9
* autopep8 version: 1.4.4 (pycodestyle: 2.5.0)
* Platform: Linux





*If this is a bug report, please explain with examples (and example code) what you expected to happen and what actually happened.*
